subject: Our Latest Spring Updates
body:
From our 2025 Gala to key industry insights—catch up with us!
 
 
Hello, Creative Spirit Connect Community 
﻿Happy Spring! We have some exciting updates to kick off the season. 
First is our annual gala, which will be held on 
April 21, 2025, at 6 p.m.
in the Board Room at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE)
. 
We’ll be honoring our 2025 Corporate Champions of Neurodiversity: 
Donna Murphy, Global CEO of Havas Health & Creative Networks
, and 
Raja Rajamannar, the Chief Marketing & Communications Officer at Mastercard
. 
We have set a brilliant goal: To empower neurodivergent individuals by creating one million fair-wage integrated opportunities by 2030—paving the road to financial independence. 
Get Your Tickets at 
HireDifferent25.givesmart.com
. 
 
Donate To Our Mission.
 
 
 
 
 
We’re excited to announce a new partnership with Havas 
Neuroverse: Powered by Havas
,
 a groundbreaking consultancy that integrates neurodivergent talent into creative, marketing, strategy, and business transformation, driving innovation and fresh perspectives. With 53% of Gen Z identifying as neurodivergent, and 1 in 5 people identifying as neurodivergent overall, inclusive hiring is the right thing to do, and it’s smart business as well. 
Read The Full Story
 
Stay Informed With Our In-Depth, Original Content
We continue to cover some of the most important disability/neurodiversity rights issues, including challenges to Social Security, Medicare, and legislation like Section 504, which has protected the rights of people with disabilities (PWD) for decades. 
Rather than being deterred by these obstacles, we see critical opportunities to share the importance of defending disability rights and ensuring fair-wage employment for the neurodiverse community. 
﻿Times like these make us eternally grateful for supporters like you who enable Creative Spirit’s mission. Working together, there’s truly no limit to what we can accomplish.
 
Beating Burnout: A Guide for Employers and Neurodiverse Professionals
﻿
by Menachem Rephun
﻿Read the full story
For Over 50 Years, Section 504 Has Protected The Rights of People With Disabilities. In An Age of Uncertainty, How Do We Protect It?
﻿
by Menachem Rephun
﻿
Read the full story
Important Findings on Disability Inclusion in Deloitte’s Survey
﻿
by Menachem Rephun
Read the full story
 
For Employers: How We Can Help You Hire Neurodiverse Talent.
At Creative Spirit, we recognize that hiring neurodivergent talent goes beyond inclusion: it unlocks a competitive advantage.
 
Here’s how we can help your organization harness this incredible potential.
Tailored Consulting and Training:
 
We provide expert guidance to help you build a workplace where neurodivergent talent can excel. Our training for teams and hiring managers focuses on best practices for successfully integrating neurodivergent employees.
 
Skill-Based Job Matching:
 
Our specialized job-matching process connects you with candidates whose unique skills align with your business needs, paving the way for mutual success.
 
Employee Resource Group (ERG) Activation:
 
We assist in developing or expanding ERG's focused on neurodiversity, fostering a supportive culture that empowers neurodivergent employees and builds community.
 
Ongoing Mentorship and Coaching:
 
Our coaching services offer neurodivergent employees the guidance they need to flourish while we mentor managers in creating supportive and stigma-free work environments.
 
Expertise Across Industries:
 
Whether in media, PR, technology, or beyond, our industry experts help you refine hiring processes and create work environments that uplift neurodivergent talent. 
Whether you’re looking to enhance hiring practices or implement training/mentorship programs, we’re here to support you every step of the way.
 
Contact Creative Spirit so we can help you start hiring employees who are neurodivergent. Whether you’re looking to enhance hiring practices or implement training and mentorship programs, we’re here to support you every step of the way.
For Neurodiverse Individuals: How We Can Support You.
 
Since 2017, Creative Spirit has connected neurodivergent professionals with top companies, achieving a 95% retention rate through personalized coaching, mentorship, and job placement. We partner directly with organizations and candidates to drive meaningful career growth—because diverse workplaces are stronger and more innovative.
Creative Spirit offers coaching and job placement services if you want to grow your career. Do you know someone who could benefit? We welcome referrals! 
﻿
Introduce us via 
Terry.Ebert@creativespirit-us.org
 and 
Register Here
.
For additional information, contact us at info@creativespirit-us.org.
  
  
  
  
 
CREATIVE SPIRIT USA INC | 
183 McLain Street
 | 
Mt.Kisco, NY 10549 US

subject: Important updates to our 401(k) policies
body:

Hi Alisa,
Thank you for being a valued Guideline customer.
We are writing to let you know about changes to Guideline’s 401(k) Terms of Service. This message is simply informational—
no action is required.
What’s changing?
The updated terms include two key changes:
Stale and uncashed checks:
 If a distribution check associated with your 401(k) account is not cashed after 180 days, the unclaimed funds will be sent to a third-party provider, PenChecks. Please note, we will attempt to contact you before transferring the unclaimed funds. For more information about PenChecks, please consult their 
Statement of Services and Fees
. 
Trading buffer:
 For certain transactions from your 401(k) account, e.g., a distribution or loan, Guideline must sell invested assets to fulfill the withdrawal amount. We are updating our 
trading process
 for how we manage these transactions.
Both of these changes will be reflected in our participant 
Terms of Service
 (“ToS”) by March 13, 2025.
If you have any questions about these changes, please visit our 
FAQ
.
Thank you, 
Team Guideline
 
This message contains important information regarding your account registered at 
Guideline
 associated with this email. You may not opt out of transactional emails sent by Guideline. If you are not the intended recipient or have received this email in error, please notify us immediately at 
support@guideline.com
 and delete this message. 
Learn more
 about how we protect your information.

Investment advisory services for Guideline's 401(k) (when 3(38) fiduciary services are selected) and SEP IRA/IRA products are offered by Guideline Investments, LLC, an SEC-registered investment advisor. For more information regarding these services, see the

subject: Understand the New ILPA Reporting & Performance Templates - EisnerAmper Webinar
body:
Last chance to register!
 
Understand the New ILPA Reporting & Performance Templates
 
What do the new ILPA Reporting Template and Performance Template mean for GPs and LPs? How do they improve standardization, transparency, and comparability in reporting for private funds?
 
EisnerAmper is pleased to host Neal Prunier and Emily Kisak of the Institutional Limited Partners Association (ILPA) as they present key features and insights on the new reporting and performance templates. For over two decades, ILPA has grown its membership to represent more than 600 LP institutions, creating a network of 7,000 professionals across more than 50 countries. Together with its members and partners, ILPA continually works toward greater transparency, governance, and alignment for the industry.
 
Course Description:
 This webinar will cover a host of hot topics so GPs and LPs understand the value and impact of these new templates.
 
Learning Outcomes:
 Throughout the discussion, attendees will learn about:
Drivers behind the initiative to update the Reporting Template and create the Performance Template
Key changes to the Reporting Template
Introduction to the Performance Template and methodology
Any implications for the SEC Marketing Rule
Considerations for implementation and collaboration between the GP, fund administrator, and LPs
REGISTER
 
Can't Attend the Live Webinar?
Register and we'll let you know when the on-demand recording is posted. Please note, on-demand viewing is not eligible for CPE credit.
 
April 2, 2025
12:00 - 1:00 PM (ET)
 
Jen Cuello
Moderator
Partner, EisnerAmper
Emily Kisak
Director of Industry Affairs, ILPA
Neal Prunier
Managing Director of Industry Affairs,
ILPA
 
 
1.0 CPE credit in 
Specialized Knowledge
 
If you meet the CPE requirements, you can download your CPE certificate at the conclusion of the event within the event platform.
Delivery Method: Group-Internet Based; Level: Basic; Advance Preparation: None; Prerequisites: None
If you have any difficulties with registration, please contact events@eisneramper.com.
 
Eisner Advisory Group LLC is registered with the National Association of State Boards of Accountancy (NASBA) as a sponsor of continuing professional education on the National Registry of CPE Sponsors. State boards of accountancy have final authority on the acceptance of individual courses for CPE credit. Complaints regarding registered sponsors may be submitted to the National Registry of CPE Sponsors through its website: 
www.NASBARegistry.org
. Eisner Advisory Group LLC National Registry Sponsor No. 108139 Texas recognizes CPE programs offered by NASBA sponsors, but requires registration with the state board. Eisner Advisory Group LLC is a registered sponsor in Texas (No. 010023). There is no fee to attend this course. For more information regarding administrative policies such as cancellations and complaints, please contact EisnerAmperU@eisneramper.com.
“EisnerAmper” is the brand name under which EisnerAmper LLP and Eisner Advisory Group LLC, independently owned entities, provide professional services in an alternative practice structure in accordance with applicable professional standards. EisnerAmper LLP is a licensed CPA firm that provides attest services
, and Eisner Advisory Group LLC and its subsidiary entities provide tax and business consulting services.

subject: progress on website updates
body:
Hi everyone - 
We started to make some of the back-end and performance updates to the LCW website last week. Most of those updates are complete (or underway) - and we are finishing up a few things now. Take a look at the Loom video to learn more - but we have:
Made some updates to improve SEO performance (more coming once we finalize the Solutions/Products)
Improved the website load speed considerably by removing translation and a few other things
Updated some plugins
Removed some forms that were not functioning properly (all forms now are through and connected to Hubspot)
We removed the dates from the blogs
Moved the 'Downloads' articles to just be blog posts (in the future, any actual downloads will be created and managed through Hubspot).
Updated the home page 'carousel' scroll of the Solutions
Next up will be a review and discussion around the 'language' (copy) on the website. Also, I know that Nicole has some thoughts on updating the Products that LCW offers (listed as Solutions on the website). I also have some thoughts on updating some images on the site . We will work with Nicole on these next steps.
https://www.loom.com/share/22f5267a27c14942b7b589e64f7f7f51?sid=68dd9dc4-b3e1-4986-9e2d-5911adec0b49
-- 
John Fischer
Partner
440-212-9977
john@pickup-studios.com

subject: Re: LCW x Hacking HR
body:
Hi Alisa,
I’m Sneha, Chief Events Strategist here at Hacking HR—so lovely to be in touch😊
Thanks again for your response. I wanted to follow up on the speaking opportunity first—please feel free to check out our Workplace Well-Being and Mental Health Summit agenda for May here: 
Agenda
. If you’d like to propose a senior-level leader from LCW for one of the panels, we’d be happy to consider it. Please note that panel slots don’t include branding, but we’d still love to feature a strong voice from your team.
Your culture-first approach to inclusion and equity is quite impressive and is exactly what the future of workplace mental health needs. The LCW Sustainable Culture of Inclusion Model actually complements the themes we’re spotlighting this year—especially around:
Reframing psychological safety and elevating it beyond policy into lived practice
Addressing mental health through inclusive systems and cultural competence
Empowering leadership to build sustainable, equitable well-being strategies
Advancing mental health as an integral part of DEI and employee experience
You’ll find panels like:
Redefining Psychological Safety at Work, Sustaining the Momentum, Building a Human-Centered Organization and more. 
These conversations will feature 
CPOs, Chief Wellbeing Officers, Global DEI Leaders, and forward-thinking practitioners
 from leading organizations—making it a great fit for LCW’s work and voice in this space, also for wide exposure. 
Now, regarding sponsorship—this summit is one of our biggest of the year and aligns greatly with LCW’s culture-first, equity-driven mission. We’ll have over 5,000 HR professionals, a very engaged audience, and a reach of 2 million+ through LinkedIn, newsletters, social media and community marketing.
Given that May is Mental Health Awareness Month, this is a great time to amplify your rebrand and show the world the work LCW is doing in inclusion and well-being. We'd love to feature your logo across all marketing and build something meaningful together only if possible. 
Give it a thought and let us know—we’d be happy to chat about how we could amplify your newly rebranded identity and help you reach your next million potential clients.
PS:
 Let’s connect on 
LINKEDIN
 if we haven’t already to receive regular updates and stay in touch!
--
--
Sneha Sandhya Yadamari
Hacking HR
Global Events & Partnerships
    
sneha@hackinghr.io
Rome, Italy, RM

subject: URGENT – April 30 Deactivation of Your Account
body:
Dear Alisa
,
We value your business and want to follow up on an 
email
 you received recently about upcoming changes to your TriNet contract. Please review this 
email
 again as it contains important information and actions you must take by April 30, 2025. 
If action is not taken by April 30, 2025, your company’s month-to-month subscription will end on April 30, 2025, and your company and employees will be offboarded from TriNet as of May 1, 2025. 
The following is important information about the offboarding process:
System Access
A 
Read Only Access
 trial is offered through April 30, 2026.
Medical/dental/vision and other lines of coverage
May continue through a 3rd party broker but will no longer be administered via the TriNet platform effective May 1, 2025.
COBRA Complete
Deactivations sent to COBRA Complete 
before
 April 25, 2025, will deactivate on April 30, 2025. Final settlements will occur by the first week of May.
Deactivations sent to COBRA Complete 
after
 April 25, 2025, will deactivate on May 31, 2025. Final settlements will occur by the first week of June. Your account must be managed directly with COBRA Complete as of May 1, 2025. 
Flexible Benefits (such as FSA, HSA and Commuter Benefits):
Deactivated May 1, 2025.
Plan(s) will be updated with 0 runout days which means employees will not be able to submit any claims.
Cancelled HSA accounts will move to retail accounts with Wealthcare Saver. Employees will receive reassociation letters with all the details.
Payroll
Deactivated May 1, 2025.
Payroll tax filings will stop immediately. Any outstanding payroll tax amounts that have not been remitted to the agency will be refunded. You will be responsible for all filings and remittance.
Annual filings will be your responsibility (If you move to another PEO, please let us know within thirty (30) days, so we can assist you with your annual filing.). 
To learn more about the options listed in the email you received recently, or to inform us if you choose not to renew your account, click 
here
:
Select the Chat Bot in the bottom right-hand corner
Select “Click Here for Support”
Type "2025 plans and packages”
Click "Email Us"
We look forward to connecting with you.
Regards,
TriNet
© 2025 TriNet Group, Inc. All rights reserved. This communication is for informational purposes only, is not legal, tax or accounting advice, and is not an offer to sell, buy or procure insurance. TriNet is the single-employer sponsor of all its benefit plans, which does not include Enrich products and voluntary benefits that are not ERISA-covered group health insurance plans and enrollment is voluntary. Official plan documents always control and TriNet reserves the right to amend the benefit plans or change the offerings and deadlines.
This communication may contain hyperlinks to websites operated by parties other than TriNet. Such hyperlinks are provided for reference only. TriNet does not control such web sites and is not responsible for their content. Inclusion of such hyperlinks in this communication does not necessarily imply any endorsement of the material or association with their operators.
Please note that you cannot opt-out of an email that is required to provide you information about your relationship with TriNet. To update the types of communications you receive from TriNet, including opting out of all non-operational email communications, 
click here
 to visit the TriNet Communication Preference Center. Or you can mail your unsubscribe request to: TriNet, One Park Place, Suite 600, Dublin, CA 94568.
C-25MAR-51

subject: Beyond The DEI Headlines: Actionable Insights - Join Me and An Esteemed Panel of Scholars
body:
Beyond
 the DEI Headlines: 
Navigating Political Risk and Policy Impacts
Political surprises are intensifying uncertainty, complexity, and volatility in business environments, causing significant disruption for employees, customers, and communities. As these shifts unfold, how can boards, CEOs, their teams, and other stakeholders effectively navigate this landscape? The key lies in understanding and proactively strategizing for political risk.
When:
 Wednesday
, April 9, 2025
Time:
 12 - 1 PM CT / 1 - 2 PM ET
Where
: Live, free, and presented virtually
 
RSVP to join us live
 
Karen Brown, Jennifer Brown, Dr. Liz Cavallaro, Greg Jenkins
 
 
 
 
 
Key Highlights: 
The administration’s policies on veterans and LGBTQ+ persons
Impact of these policies
Strategies and tools to move forward with confidence
Open to all 
sectors
 and industries:

✔️ Anyone with interest

subject: Webinar: Workplace Strategies for Hybrid and Distributed Teams
body:
Register for actionable insights on how to optimize the office.

Hi Alisa,
Hybrid work is here to stay. So how can companies optimize their workplace strategies to help foster a happier, more engaged workforce?
Join us for this webinar as Philip Ross, CEO of 
UnWork
 and Luke Armstrong, WeWork Regional President - UK&I, EMEA & Asia-Pacific, discuss how business leaders can equip their teams with the right strategies to thrive in a flexible work environment.
Register now
 
 
During this session, our expert panel will explore:
Why flexibility and scalability are crucial for successful hybrid teams
Ways to balance productivity and wellbeing in a distributed workforce
How to leverage AI and tech innovation to enhance both the workplace and the workforce
The details:
Date:
 Thursday, April 10
Time:
 11am ET
Register today
 to secure your spot.
We look forward to having you join the discussion!
- The WeWork Team

Hi there,
 
I know we each have sales goals/KPIs & we are doing our best to reach those - making calls, responding to clients, tracking everything in HubSpot, etc. The LCW webinars, email campaigns, and our reach out efforts have increased traffic and interest in LCW - yay!
 
The areas I think we need to step up are 
speaking engagements & online presence.
 
I believe we agreed that 
Alisa
 would try to 
speak at 1 live event (virtual or in-person) once per month
. I know there is something upcoming.
 
I believe we agreed 
Chuck 
would try to do 
1 live event per quarter
,
 
in addition to
 the 1 or 2 LCW webinars
 he is leading 
each month
.
 
I would also kindly ask you both to 
post as much on LinkedIn
 as possible. I see you both do this. It would be great if you can increase that whenever possible.
 
To help in your search for where to speak, I've compiled the below orgs to help. 
 
As part of our
 sales strategy,
 we should be targeting 
legal
 orgs/associations (because they are always looking for DEI vendors & are often required to provide DEI services of some sort); 
HR 
orgs/associations (because as you know, we can find corporate DEI professionals here, and as DEI teams are disbanded, HR folks need to upskill), and 
Training & Development
 orgs/associations (similar to HR).
 
Here are suggested orgs to reach out to & approach for speaking gigs:
 
LEGAL
 
https://www.lcld.com/event/diversity-professionals-virtual-meeting-february-2025/
https://www.nalp.org/index.cfm
https://alfdp.com/
 
HR / L&D
https://hackinghrlab.io/events/people-culture-strategy-summit/
https://www.chicagoshrm.org/
 
https://atdchi.org/
 
I've attached a list of conferences
, but for most, we have missed the deadline for speaking. 
Of course there are many more opportunities out there. Please research on your own.
We hope to hire an admin shortly who can help us with these conference efforts - apply on our behalf to speak/present, find opportunities, etc.
 
Helpful tips:
Attached is a suggestion of what you can use to pitch to orgs to talk about - of course you can choose whatever you like
Post 3 times on LinkedIn about the event you will be speaking at
"Come see me speak at...."
Tag the LCW LinkedIn page & LCW employees so they can share
Tag the org hosting the event & others at that org you have spoken with
Tag others you know that might also spread the word - this can include clients, friends, orgs, etc.
"It's almost here - register for....." (tag as above)
"Thank you to X for having me..." (tag as above)
Use hashtags such as #DEI, #InclusionMatters, #BelongingAtWork #HR #HRLeadership #LearningAndDvelopment #TalentDevelopment
 
Happy to talk about this on our next call.
LMK if you have any questions.
 
Thanks!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

subject: Join CIBC Private Wealth for the Financial Forum Webinar Series
body:
Financial Forum Webinar Series
Answering the financial questions of the rising generations
Building your investment portfolio
The prospect of starting your investment journey can feel overwhelming due to the vast array of options, complex terminology, and the fear of making costly mistakes. However, investing for your future is not only beneficial; it’s essential. Our experienced experts are here to help explain the process, empowering you to take charge of your financial future.
We hope you will join us for the seventh webinar in 
CIBC’s Financial Forum
 series. Please also forward this invitation to interested family members, friends or colleagues.
Wednesday, April 23, 2025
1:00 p.m. ET / 12:00 p.m. CT / 10:00 a.m. PT

Serial Growth Lab 
by HauerX Holdings
April 1, 2025
 
Turning AI Innovation into Market Leadership
 
Ever wonder how AI really shifts a brand’s trajectory? This week, we’re exploring:
1 - Marketing Magic: 7 campaigns blending AI with human insight
2 - Always-On Growth: How AI is transforming CPG strategies
3 - Pinpointing Influencers: Nichefire’s next-level targeting
4 - Gen AI Shopping Trends: Surprising data from Prime & Walmart+
Instead of hype, you’ll see how AI is driving measurable impact—right now.
01—Blending Human Insight and AI: 7 Marketing Campaigns That Go Beyond the Ordinary
Insights + AI = Authentic Innovation
 
02—Always-On Growth: AI’s Next Frontier for CPG
Explore "Always-On" Growth in CPG
 
03—Stop Searching, Start Connecting: Nichefire’s AI Solution for Finding Influencers Who Move the Needle
Find My Brand Influencers
 
04—Did You Know? 1 in 3 Prime and Walmart+ Shoppers Already Use Gen AI To Shop
See the Data
 
AI is no longer a nice-to-have—it’s defining tomorrow’s winners. If you’re ready to move from exploring to deploying AI for business results, let’s connect.
Jason

subject: Get Seen Online, Enhance Your Rep! Click Here.
body:
Blogging: Establish Your Cred,
Expand Your Marketing
Tuesday, April 15, 2025, 11am to 12:30pm Eastern Time
Attend the live webinar to participate in our Q&A.
Reserve My Spot!
 
Can’t make it to the webinar?
Register anyway and we’ll send you the recording.
Blogging increases the number of people
who find you on the web 
AND
 reinforces your reputation
as an expert in your field.
It gets you seen on more social media platforms and gives you 
the opportunity to share your knowledge with the public and 
your current customers/clients.
During this live webinar, Social Media Expert Vik Rajan shows 
you the blogging tools and techniques you need to get the results you want.
 
At the end of this webinar, you will have the knowledge and resources to:
List the 5 parts of a blog that Google and other search engines look for 
Describe how to optimize your blog for social media sharing by others 
Summarize how to get 5 pieces of “cascading content” from a 1-time effort 
Embed video and podcasts into your blog website 
Develop a never-ending list of blog topics 
Prioritize your Content Calendar from themes to topics to Titles 
 
Host and Facilitator: 
Jim Alles
Chief executive with e-commerce background and experience; expertise in computer systems, software programs, and web design. SCORE NYC Mentor.
Your Instructor:
Vik Rajan
Co-founder of VideoSocials and
its VideoInterviewpodcasts.com
system. Hosts his own podcasts.
His firm runs over 22 podcasts
﻿for other clients.
 
 
REGISTER
 
THIS IS A PAID WEBINAR
 
﻿
SCORE is funded in part through a Cooperative Agreement with the U.S. Small Business Administration. All opinions, conclusions, and/or recommendations expressed herein are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the SBA.

subject: Re: Gong Customer Stories
body:
Hey Alisa,  
I hope you had a great weekend. I wanted to follow up and see what your thoughts were on the security and customer stories I sent over. Want to chat more this week? 
Thanks,  
 
On Thu, Mar 27, 2025 at 9:24 AM Alex Stringfellow <
alex.stringfellow@gong.io
> wrote:
Hey Alisa,  
It was great connecting with you yesterday! Based on our discussion, it is clear that Gong would be a major asset to your team. I've included below a handful of  case studies. 
What time next week is good for us to connect again?  
Future with Gong
:
 
End-to-End Visibility
: Understand what resonates with customers, quantify and reinforce messaging, and tie outcomes to objectives, automatically.
AI-Driven Outcomes
: Streamline outreach with AI-driven outcomes - leverage auto-generated call summaries to gain insight, drive next steps, and guide efforts based on dynamic tasks.
Customer Case Studies Videos:
 
Use case: 
Sales Management / Customer Support / RevOpps / Sales Rep  
  
Vercara 
-
 (Video Link)
Key Outcomes
:
Front line managers save 3-4 hours a week on manual labor of spreadsheets and learning what's in their teams forecast. 
Canva 
-
 (Video Link)
Key Outcomes
:
60% jump in rep capacity.
6% revenue boost 
Elsevier 
- 
(Video Link)
 (My personal favorite)
Key Outcomes
:
35% boost in deal velocity 
45% Growth in deal size 
Paycor 
- 
(Video Link)
 ( Cross Selling)
Key Outcomes
:
The platform helps my leaders decide where to focus their attention and where to place their bets. And the payoff has been massive. We’ve seen a 141% increase in the number of upselling deals closed per seller across the team.”
 
—
Jeff Weaver, VP Client Sales, Paycor
 
As he puts it, “I couldn’t be more sincere when I say that Gong’s AI is truly game changing.” How else can you describe a solution that helps a revenue team go from struggling to oversee their pipeline to one that manages it effectively, forecasts more accurately, and ultimately upsells to win 141% more deals?
Use cases for those who want to read more!
 
Appen 
(see attachment)
Key Outcomes
:
Shared Memory: All calls and emails for the entire lifecycle of the account are recorded and easily searchable.
Reduced Churn: Gong’s insights help teams uncover the lead indicators of customer churn — quickly and
efficiently get alerted on critical renewals for competitive and market-risk accounts.
Voice of Customer: Share the true voice of the customer with the product, product marketing, customer
education, and operations teams.
Drive Upsell Opportunity & Growth: Easily monitor leading indicators of customer growth
Corporate Traveler
 (
Video Link
)
Focus
:
Perfect customer onboarding
Create seamless handovers
Focus on the voice of the customer
Enable peer-to-peer learning
Quote
: 
"It’s vital that the customer is heard and not just talked to. We realized that by listening better and providing smooth customer handoffs, we’d be able to increase adoption and retention rates among our customer base."
 - Ben HobbsVP of Customer Success 
Khoros
Outcome
: Gong’s features like scorecards and trackers allowed Khoros’ CS team to set streamlined goals across regions, which resulted in more focused feedback to CSMs and managers who could better coach their team to hit targets. More regular, consistent feedback led to greater accountability and skill-specific improvement.
Quote
: "Each of our five pillars can be addressed in a call with a customer through Gong. That’s where I’ve seen the power of the tool." - 
Chelsea Knudsen, 
Regional Manager of Customer Success
Momentive
 (see attachment)
Outcome
: Gong’s features helped the Customer Success team at Momentive move towards a more comprehensive customer success coaching program, which vastly improved the customer experience. Momentive now uses reality-based information to ensure that the entire team is on the same page, with a single standard of care that makes clients feel cared for
Quote
: 
"After listening to Gong calls, we realized that we could improve the consistency in how our customer-facing roles executed calls.”
 - Kim Nguyen Enablement Manager, Customer Success
Udemy
 (
Link
)
Areas of Impact
: 
Deal execution and forecasting
Sales productivity
Business alignment
Smart guidance
Quote
: 
“I don’t know how I used to do my job before Gong,” shared Eric. “Gong brings deep customer understanding, clarity, and insight into my world.”
 - Eric Stoddard, Head of Global Sales and Customer Success Enablement
-- 
Alex Stringfellow
Senior Commercial Account Executive - Emerging Markets
alex.stringfellow@gong.io
www.gong.io

Alex Stringfellow

subject: You’re invited to 1871’s Birthday Bash! 🎈🎂
body:
Celebrate 1871’s birthday and say farewell to our Merchandise Mart space on April 23!
 
Hi Alisa, 
 
Save the date for 1871’s 13th birthday party! This is our last hurrah in the Merchandise Mart — let’s cherish the memories we’ve created in this space as a community! 
 
Join us for drinks, snacks, and music, and help us give this physical office a proper send off! 
🎉 Where? 
1871
 
🎉 When? 
April 23 | 5:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m. CDT
 
🎉 Why? 
Let’s kickoff this new era of 1871, together. Plus, 13 is a big year!
A quick message from our CEO ⬇
 
RSVP!
 
 
 
 
More fun details to come — we hope to see you there!
 
Team 1871
 
Global Innovation Hub
 
1871
, 222 W. Merchandise Mart Plaza, 
Suite 1212,  Chicago, IL, 60654

subject: 5 Things: Chicagoland's Weekly Business Update
body:
Delivered by Southwest Airlines 
 
Click 
here
 
to view this email in your browser.
 
 
 
 
 
Weekly Business Update 
March 31, 2025
Delivered by
 
THE EXCHANGE
4 Reasons to Attend The Exchange 2025
PRESENTED BY
 THE CHICAGOLAND CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
 
Looking for the ultimate networking experience in Chicago? The Exchange 2025 brings together top professionals, industry insights, and exclusive perks—all in one place. From dynamic connections to expert-led discussions and a culinary experience you won’t want to miss, this event offers something for everyone. Plus, it all takes place at one of the city’s most iconic venues. Curious to learn more? Discover four reasons why you can’t afford to miss The Exchange 2025!
LEARN MORE
 
MEMBER NEWS
Last Call to Register for J.P. Morgan Corporate Challenge Chicago!
PRESENTED BY JPMORGANCHASE
 
Registration for the J.P. Morgan Corporate Challenge Chicago closes in three days on Thursday, April 10 at 8:00 p.m. An iconic event since 1982, returns to Chicago for the 42nd year running at Grant Park. Join the Chicago business community Thursday, May 8, at 6:50 p.m. for a 3.5-mile run/walk and post-race party. Spots are available for all businesses in Chicagoland, with a minimum team size of four and no maximum.
REGISTER NOW
 
UPCOMING EVENT
Showcasing Promising Talent Solutions 
PRESENTED BY CORPORATE COALITION OF CHICAGO
 
Join The Corporate Coalition and leading Chicago organizations for Showcasing Promising Talent Solutions, a free virtual event on Thursday, April 24, from noon to 1 p.m. This business-focused showcase will explore strategies for inclusive workplaces, talent pipelines, fair chance hiring, and apprenticeships, with insights on emerging issues like AI in the workforce. Hear from companies implementing innovative solutions and gain practical takeaways to address human capital challenges. Don’t miss this opportunity to connect, learn, and take action.
REGISTER NOW
 
UPCOMING EVENT
Bank of America’s Sara DeCoste Sits Down with Emerging Leaders 
PRESENTED BY THE CHICAGOLAND CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
 
Join Emerging Leaders Chicago for a fireside chat on April 22 featuring Board Member Sara DeCoste, Managing Director, Senior Treasury Sales Manager at Bank of America. The Emerging Leaders Fireside Chat Series provides an exclusive opportunity for young professionals to learn from tenured experts about past experiences, industry insights, personal mantras, and much more. Register now through April 15 to receive an early-bird discount.
REGISTER NOW
 
MEMBER NEWS
A Pivotal Moment for the Autism Community: The Empower Summit & Challenge Fueled by Autism Speaks 
PRESENTED BY AUTISM SPEAKS
 
Rise to the challenge and get your adrenaline pumping on day two of the Empower Challenge where you can choose to run, ride, or walk to make a lifetime of difference for people with autism! Join with friends, colleagues, and the autism community to raise critical funds, drive awareness and demonstrate how together, we are creating a more inclusive world. Register today for the Dallas/ Fort Worth Empower Summit and Challenge on April 11-12.
REGISTER NOW
 
Want to showcase your company news, information, products, or services?
 
Chamber members are able to take advantage of a myriad of benefits to help your business grow, including inclusion in this email newsletter. With a broad distribution, you can gain access to a new audience that you may not otherwise be able to reach.
REVIEW BENEFITS
 
 
FOLLOW THE CHAMBER
 
 
 
 
 
WWW.CHICAGOLANDCHAMBER.ORG
The Chicagoland Chamber of Commerce
The Wrigley Building | 410 N Michigan Ave | Suite 900
Chicago, IL 60611
 
Change Your Subscription Preferences
 at any time.
For information about our privacy practices, view our 
Privacy Policy
.

subject: David Brooks: Discerning Purpose in Life’s Second Half
body:
A conversation on personal growth and meaningful relationships. 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Discerning Purpose in Life’s Second Half:
A Conversation with David Brooks
   
Online | Monday, April 7 | 1:00pm CT
Join our conversation with 
New York Times
 columnist and UChicago Leadership & Society Initiative Senior Fellow David Brooks about longevity, the changing structure of adulthood, and how to design a purposeful “second mountain.”
Register Now >
 
Other Upcoming Events
Leading with Practical Wisdom: Navigating Self and the World
Online | Tuesday, April 1 | 1:00pm CT
Explore how ancient philosophy and modern thinking can enhance our decision-making and leadership abilities.
Register Now >
Strategic Leadership in Dynamic Times
Online | Friday, April 4 | 11:00am CT
Join us for a conversation with Alan Murray, President of The WSJ Leadership Institute, to explore why the pace of change in business and society is accelerating and how leaders can successfully navigate and win in this rapidly transforming world.
Register Now >
Leadership & Society Initiative Symposium
In-person | Thursday, April 24 | 8:00am CT
The Symposium offers a glimpse into LSI’s three-part learning journey through a series of lectures from eminent scholars, workshops with industry leaders, and opportunities to connect with purpose-driven executives.
Request Invitation >
Explore All Events >
 
LSI Invites Candidacies For Our 2025-2026 Cohort
We are currently inviting candidates for our third cohort of 
Leadership & Society Initiative Fellows
. To be considered in this selection round, individuals must 
start their candidacy
 by April 1.
Start Candidacy >

subject: Fw: Alisa Kolodizner
body:
Hi Alisa,

Hope you're doing well! My name is Taylor, and I’m reaching out from Chronicle, a ghostwriting firm based in Texas.

We recently received a form submission on our website mentioning you as someone with a compelling story worth writing about. It included your email, but there wasn’t much detail beyond that. Since we get a fair number of anonymous submissions, I wanted to personally check in and see if this was actually from you (or maybe someone you know).

I checked out your LinkedIn and saw your work at LCW—really interesting stuff! If the submission was genuine and you're open to discussing, I’d love to learn more about your background and any publishing aspirations you might have.

If you didn’t submit it, not a problem—I just wanted to make sure before moving forward. Let me know whenever you get a chance.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

All the best,
Taylor

subject: Your Business Plan, Your Success!
body:
A Business Plan That Meets Your Needs
Wednesday, April 2, 2025, 11am to 1pm Eastern Time
Attend the live webinar to participate in our Q&A.
Reserve My Spot!
 
You must attend the webinar to receive the recording and slides.
A well-crafted business plan is crucial to the success
﻿
of your business.
The plan is a flexible road map to guide you as you build, grow or diversify your business. It also establishes your credibility with 
potential investors and funders. 
Two experienced SCORE NYC mentors will walk you through the key elements of an effective business plan. 
 
 
At the end of this webinar, you will be able to:
 
Describe the reasons to prepare a business plan 
List the top 10 requirements for success 
Assess your business model 
Summarize the structure of a business plan 
Discuss the business planning process based on a small business case study
 
Speaker:
Sandy Eames
Marketing and business development executive with expertise in business strategy, business plans, outbound marketing product development 
and strategic alliances. 
﻿
SCORE NYC Mentor.
﻿
Speaker:
Jerry Baron
Experienced professional 
providing growth strategies for 
small and mid-size businesses, especially start-ups and nonprofits. SCORE NYC Mentor.
 
REGISTER
 
This webinar is presented free through the generosity of
a donor who wishes to remain anonymous.
 
 
 
﻿
SCORE is funded in part through a Cooperative Agreement with the U.S. Small Business Administration. All opinions, conclusions, and/or recommendations expressed herein are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the SBA.

subject: Important update about your vision plan
body:
View this email as a web page 
here
 
Important update to 
your vision plan
What’s happening:
 In the spirit of continuous improvement, we periodically evaluate our offerings and help make adjustments, as needed. 
Based on a recent analysis of our current vision care insurance vendor offerings, we have decided to no longer offer Avēsis as a vision insurance option for our customers
.
 
What this means for you:
 We are doing everything we can to minimize disruption for current Avēsis vision care planholders and members, like you. To that end, at your renewal you will be matched with an equivalent Davis Vision plan at your current rate. Davis Vision provides comprehensive benefits with more than 152,000 access points. Look for more details in your renewal package. 
We recognize the important role eye health plays in overall health and well-being. That’s why we want to help ensure we provide you and your employees with vision care benefits that help make eye exams, prescription glasses, contacts, and other forms of eye care accessible and affordable.  
For further details or if you have any questions, please contact your Guardian representative.
 
GUARDIAN
®
 is a registered trademark of The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America. ©2025 Guardian. The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America, New York, NY.
 
The Guardian Life Insurance Company of America
10 Hudson Yards, New York, NY 10001
 
You received this email, because you are subscribed to Marketing Information from the Guardian Life Insurance Company of America.
 
Unsubscribe
 
Privacy Statement

Mastering the Strategies and Applications of Generative AI
This 12-week advanced Certificate Program (April–July 2025) is about EVERYTHING you need to know about strategy, innovation, and action in AI. 
 
🚀

A solid foundation in generative AI fundamentals and models

HR leaders and professionals

HR's Role in Transformation
Did you know that 
7 in 10 business failures

leadership, culture, and adaptability
 challenges? 
Yet only

In our latest

 and the 
“hats” HR leaders wear
:
 
The EX Strategist
 – Aligns talent and workforce strategies with business goals.
The Culture Architect
 – Cultivates Psychological Safety and Builds an Inclusive Culture
The Data Jedi 
– Uses people analytics for strategic decision-making.
The Growth Guru 
– Develops continuous learning programs to future-proof the workforce.
The Connector
 – Bridges employees, leaders, and teams for alignment and engagement. 
 
HR leaders must 
navigate constant change
 while 
ensuring employees remain engaged, productive, and aligned 
with business goals. However, managing people, payroll, and performance across multiple teams and locations can be overwhelming without the right tools.
Discover how 
Keka
 simplifies HR processes and operatio
ns with an 
all-in-one platform
 that creates seamless employee experiences from hire to retire.
Join 10,000+ companies worldwide using Keka to transform HR into a strategic powerhouse! 
 
Discover how Keka HR can help your HR team lead transformational change
.
­

Participants will learn and put into practice the skills necessary to translate business strategies into actionable HR initiatives that drive organizational performance. 
 
This Certificate Program is ideal for HR leaders (directors, VPs, and C-suite) eager to deepen their strategic roles!

HR Technology and Digital Transformation Summit
We are excited to invite you to join us in the impactful and relevant, 100% Free + 100% Virtual Event:
HR Technology and Digital Transformation Summit
HR leaders have an unprecedented opportunity to harness technology and digital innovation as the driving forces behind transformation in the workplace. 
The 
HR Technology and Digital Transformation Summit
 is designed to equip HR leaders and professionals with the strategies, tools, and insights to lead this transformation effectively.
This three-day summit will enable seasoned HR leaders, technology innovators, and business strategists to shape the future of work. From understanding the state of HR technology to implementing advanced digital solutions, attendees will explore critical themes that address both immediate challenges and long-term opportunities. The summit offers a blend of deep-dive discussions, actionable insights, and collaborative learning, ensuring participants leave with a roadmap to elevate their organizations through technology.
Topics
Day 1: Foundations of HR Technology and Digital Transformation
 
📊 
The State of HR Technology in 2025:
 Exploring emerging trends and technologies shaping the HR landscape.
🛠️ 
Building a Digital HR Strategy:
 Developing comprehensive strategies to integrate technology into HR functions.
🔄 
HR Technology Adoption and Change Management:
 Addressing challenges and solutions for seamless tech adoption.
💻 
Leveraging HR Platforms and Tools:

📈 
The ROI of HR Technology Investments:

Day 2: Implementing and Optimizing HR Technology
 
🤖 
AI and Automation in HR:
 Transforming talent management and HR operations through AI-driven solutions.
📊 
HR Data and Analytics:
 Using data-driven insights to make strategic workforce decisions.
🌐 
Digital Transformation for Employee Experience:

🧑‍💼 
HR Technology for Talent Acquisition:

✅

 Ensuring technology meets regulatory and organizational standards.
 
Day 3: The Future of HR Technology and Innovation
 
✨ 
Personalization at Scale:
 Using technology to create individualized employee experiences.
🌟 
The Role of HR in Driving Digital Transformation:
 Positioning HR as a leader in organizational change.
🚀 
Integrating Emerging Technologies in HR:
 Exploring the potential of VR, blockchain, and other innovations.
🌱 
Sustainable HR Technology Solutions:

🔮

HR Technology and Digital Transformation Summit
Are you interested in becoming a sponsor of the summit? 
Reach out to us! Laurie Baggarly: 
laurie@hackinghr.io
 
­
Workplace Wellbeing and Mental Health Summit
The
 Workplace Well-Being and Mental Health Summit
 is designed to equip HR leaders, business executives, and well-being advocates with the strategies, insights, and tools to create mentally healthy workplaces where employees and organizations can thrive together. This three-day summit will bring together leading voices in mental health, workplace wellness, and people strategy to explore the most pressing well-being challenges and the innovative solutions shaping the future.
 
From integrating mental health into business strategy to leveraging technology for scalable well-being initiatives, attendees will engage in deep conversations that translate into actionable solutions.
 
This summit provides a platform for learning, collaboration, and the exchange of groundbreaking ideas—ensuring that well-being becomes a long-term organizational priority, not just a temporary initiative.
 
Topics
 
Day 1: Breaking the Silence—Building a Workplace Culture That Supports Mental Health
 
🧠 The State of Workplace Mental Health in 2025: Addressing the growing challenges of stress, burnout, and disengagement.
🚀 From Awareness to Action: Moving beyond conversations to implement real mental health support systems.
🔒 Redefining Psychological Safety at Work: Creating environments where employees feel safe to speak up and seek help.
⚠️ Workplace Stress and Burnout Crisis: Identifying early warning signs and effective prevention strategies.
👥 The Leadership Role in Mental Health: How managers and executives can actively support employee well-being.
 
Day 2: The Science of Well-Being—Practical Strategies for Resilience and Mental Health
 
🌍 The Future of Work and Employee Mental Health: How changing work models impact well-being and what companies can do about it.
🧘 Beyond Mindfulness: Evidence-Based Strategies for Mental Wellness at Work: Exploring tools that improve focus, resilience, and emotional regulation.
🏋️ The Role of Physical Health in Mental Well-Being: How movement, sleep, and nutrition impact workplace performance.
💻 Technology and Mental Health: The impact of AI, digital overload, and hybrid work on psychological well-being.
📊 Measuring What Matters: Tracking and Evaluating Workplace Well-Being Initiatives for Real Impact.
 
Day 3: The Future of Workplace Well-Being—Sustaining Long-Term Mental Health Strategies
 
🏢 Beyond Benefits: Creating a Workplace That Truly Supports Mental Health: Redesigning policies, workflows, and work environments for long-term success.
⚡ Resilience in a High-Pressure Work Environment: Teaching teams how to thrive despite constant change and uncertainty.
🌍 The Inclusion of Mental Health in DEI Initiatives: Ensuring that well-being is prioritized across diverse workforce needs.
🤝 Building a Human-Centered Organization: Embedding mental health into leadership development and corporate culture.
🔄 Sustaining the Momentum: Ensuring Mental Health Is a Business Priority Beyond Awareness Months.
Workplace Wellbeing and Mental Health Summit
Are you interested in becoming a sponsor of the summit? 
Reach out to us! Laurie Baggarly: 
laurie@hackinghr.io
 
­
The AI Experience Summit
The 
AI Experience Summit
 is designed to equip business leaders, HR professionals, and technology strategists with the insights, tools, and frameworks needed to harness AI effectively. This 
three-day summit 
will 
bring together leading voices in AI
, workforce innovation, and business transformation to explore the most pressing challenges and groundbreaking opportunities that AI presents.
 
From embedding AI into business strategy to preparing workforces for AI-driven change, attendees will engage in discussions that translate into actionable solutions. This summit provides a platform for learning, collaboration, and the exchange of cutting-edge ideas—ensuring that AI becomes a driver of sustainable business and workforce success, not just a technological trend.
 
With sessions covering 
AI’s impact on leadership
, 
workforce transformation
, 
ethical considerations
, and 
business innovation
, participants will leave with the knowledge, frameworks, and competencies needed to navigate the AI-powered future with confidence and strategic vision.
 
The 
AI Experience Summit 
is the premier platform for business, HR, and technology leaders to explore how AI is reshaping work, enhancing human capabilities, and unlocking new levels of business performance.

subject: FREE Webinar | Driving Change at Scale: Unlocking the Right Priorities, Habits, and Systems
body:
In a world that is constantly evolving, the ability to enact lasting change is not just a skill but a necessity....
 
 
Hi Alisa,
We are thrilled to invite you to a transformative webinar that delves into the core principles of driving meaningful change at scale through the lens of 
Priorities, Habits, and Systems
.
 
In a world that is constantly evolving, the ability to enact lasting change is not just a skill but a necessity.
 
Join us as we explore the key strategies and insights that can empower individuals, teams, and organizations to catalyze impactful change and achieve remarkable results.
 
On 
3rd of April at
 
11:00am BST
, our Master Facilitator and Facilitation Lead, 
Marcia Smythe
 will share how to:
Gain insights into the fundamental principles of change management.
Learn strategies to effectively prioritize initiatives and tasks.
Understand the role of habits in driving consistent and sustainable change.
Discover how to design systems that facilitate continuous improvement.
Interact with experts and peers to address your unique challenges.
Walk away with actionable steps to initiate change in your personal and professional life.
 
Marcia Smythe
Master Facilitator and Facilitation Lead, NLI
 
In addition to being a Master Facilitator herself, Ms. Smythe is responsible for leading and developing the Corporate Solutions and Education facilitation teams within NLI EMEA, ensuring that we maintain quality
high standards of delivery and generate greater learner insight. Prior to joining NLI in 2003, Ms Smythe had over thirty years Board level experience as Director Sales, Marketing and Client Development, within the Financial Services, Management Consultancy and Recruitment sectors. Ms. Smythe is an Executive Coach, with over 4000 coaching hours, and a Coach Supervisor. She has completed a Post Graduate Diploma in Neuroscience of Leadership and holds a Degree in Business Administration.
REGISTER
 
 
 
 
 
NeuroLeadership Institute, 30 Churchill Place, London, United Kingdom E14 5RE

subject: Looking for Funding? Learn How to Make Your Pitch Stand Out!
body:
Pitching to Investors
Friday, April 4, 2025, 1pm to 4:30pm Eastern Time
In-person workshop in midtown Manhattan
Reserve My Spot
 
Persuading Investors is an Art 
AND
 a Science!
Presenting yourself to prospective investors 
﻿
can be key to funding success.
An effective pitch enhances your credibility and your chances of getting the resources you need to fuel your business.
 
Find out the key elements of an effective pitch and how to deliver a story that resonates. 
You’ll have an opportunity to practice your pitch and get real-time feedback.
At the end of this workshop, you will have the knowledge and resources to
: 
Differentiate between pitching to buyers and investors 
Identify the objectives of a compelling pitch 
Outline the key components of your company’s pitch 
Craft messaging that tells a compelling investor story 
Design investor outreach tailored to your company 
Deliver your pitch and handle investor Q&A effectively 
 
 
Speaker: Carolyn Katz
Former venture capital investor 
and small business owner; expert 
on startup and small business 
funding and preparation of investor 
and pitch materials; frequent webinar presenter on small business loans 
﻿
and other funding options.
 
 
REGISTER
 
This is a PAID, IN-PERSON workshop and will not be recorded.
﻿
Make sure you can attend in-person before registering.
 
 
﻿

subject: AI Platform Comparison – ChatGPT, Claude & Perplexity
body:
Ehast WEorks Best For You!
 
 
 
 
AI Platform Comparison - ChatGPT, Claude & Perplexity
Wednesday, April 9th, 1 pm ET
 
Understanding AI tools is essential for small business owners looking to improve efficiency and stay competitive. This webinar will provide a side-by-side comparison of three leading AI platforms—ChatGPT, Claude, and Perplexity. We’ll explore their capabilities, strengths, and ideal use cases for small businesses. Learn how each platform handles tasks and discover which AI tool aligns best with your business needs.
During this webinar, we’ll cover: 
Unique features to each platform
If it’s necessary to use all three
What each platform is better at than the others
 
Can't Make the Live Session?
 
Don't worry, everyone who registers will receive the slides and recording the day after the webinar. 
 
Register Now
 
 
 
 
 
PRESENTER
Jennifer Shaheen
﻿Expertly guiding business owners through the intersection of marketing and technology for over 20 years, Jennifer Shaheen has unique expertise that combines technical prowess, entrepreneurial insight, and marketing acumen. Her marketing strategy, brand development, and small business operations skills have been engaged in the retail, manufacturing, hospitality, health care, and travel industries.
 
 
SCORE CARES
SCORE’s caring volunteers are available for mentoring to assist as always by
email, phone & video.
Contact Your Nearest Chapter:
www.score.org
 • 
www.nymetroareascore.org
 
 
SCORE is a nonprofit association dedicated to helping small businesses get off the ground, grow and achieve their goals through education and mentorship. We have been doing
this for more than 50 years.
 
Because our work is supported by the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA), and thanks to our network of 10,000+ volunteers, we are able to deliver our services at no charge or
at a very low cost.
Find out more about our Mission, Vision and Values

Subject:
 Follow up- LCW & Booth
 
 
Hi Alisa,
 
Hope you had a great week so far.
 
We have summarized the information you need from our last meeting, as described below. Could you please let us know if we answered your questions or if additional information is needed?
 
Medium~ small companies/ institutions list.
We summarized the tech company, education system, hospital system, and non-profit organizations in the Chicago/IL area. Information included name, social media, and contact information (not specific person).
Medium 
～
 Small Companies/ Instituations in Chicago/IL area
Medium 
～
 Small Companies/ Instituations in Chicago/IL area Tech company Medium Tech Chicago Office Employee Industry Website LinkedIn Repution.com 201-500 Online reputation management platform Website in Spothero 201-500 Parking platform Website in Sprout Social 1K-5K S...
docs.google.com
 
Other versions of "Thank you" email also attached.
 
Digital marketing strategy.
 
We've attached the link in the slides to where the Cultural Intelligence Center advertised their healthcare grants. Implementing this simple link increases traffic and incentivizes businesses to utilize LCW's services. I've also noticed that the Testimonials under "Our Impact" and the "Case Studies" are all the same. We recommend adding more testimonials, anonymous if needed, and case studies to increase LCW's authenticity.
 
Branding
Branding helps a brand attract new customers. It's a good practice for a brand to leverage its legacy to create a sense of trust and confidence.
Since Google Analytics shows only one visitor, this indicates that the website is not optimized for SEO.
On-Page SEO: Focus on keyword optimization, content optimization, and tag optimization.
Off-Page SEO: Prioritize local SEO (very important to target customers where we can provide services), backlinks, and linking social media to the website.
HubSpot dashboard helps analyze traffic from different sources and campaigns.
Branding and website optimization plan documents are attached.
 
Grants
How to apply for these grants? Answer: When you go to the link provided on the grants slide, it will have multiple tabs and one of the tabs will take you to How to apply process. For example: 
Why did we decide to choose only these grants? Answer: This was filtered based on availability of funds. These grants offer funds upwards of $50,000. There are many small grants available in the range of $500-$2000. It takes more time and less output to go after these grants. Also, there are many federal grants which are a subset of the grants listed on the slide. They will redirect you to the same website listed on the slides.
Thank you, 
 
Warm regards,
Demin, Teja, Khoa, Subhan and Jeetu

Ready to Start a Food Products Business?
body:
Recipe for Success: Launch & Optimize
﻿
Your Food Products Business
Friday, April 11, 2025, 11am to 1pm Eastern Time
Attend the live webinar to participate in our Q&A. 
Reserve My Spot!
 
Can’t make it to the webinar?
Register anyway and we’ll send you the recording.
Want to start or grow your food products business?
Knowing the food products business landscape will help you start and grow your own food business.
Discover three key ingredients for success: leveraging market trends 
with authentic story while understanding what will drive your profits.
 
Food industry business expert 
Terry Frishman
 will provide tactics and strategies that can help make your vision a reality!
 
Lots of time for Q&A!
At the end of this session, you will have the resources and knowledge to:
Describe the Importance of Industry Immersion
Focus on 2 Key Profit Drivers
Leverage Culinest's MegaTrends, to Increase Consumer Value 
Develop a Meaningful
 
Mission Statement
 
 
 
Identify What Goes into Powerful Product
 
Positioning 
 
Utilize Packaging, Production, Price and Sales Strategies
 
﻿
Your Host and Speaker:
Terry Frishman
Industry thought leader and 
Principal of Culinest, a food 
business consultancy. Helps 
companies profitably excel 
through consulting and inspiring, 
action-oriented education. 
 
REGISTER

From:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Friday, March 28, 2025 5:30 AM
To:
 Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>; Alisa Kolodizner <a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Fw: Sales Reminders & Speaking Opportunities
 
Sorry I won't make the sales call today. I didn't calculate time to get to the airport 
🙂
. I'll be working in the morning & out Monday...but I'll check emails.
 
Some updates:
No movement from any of my active deals just yet
Giant Eagle RFI - should have an update next week
Had 1 call this week with Choice Hotels - their budget is paused
Trans & non-binary webinar went off yesterday - email will be sent out to all registrants + attendees with special offers
Email campaigns underway for March + April
April webinar for Howard Ross & Chuck & RP planned for April 23
Team will begin speaker applications for SHRM Inclusion 2025 conference
Emails & calls to all dormant clients in HubSpot still going out, as well as to recently active clients with no open SOWs 
 
Let's work on more posting on LinkedIn & trying to speak as much as possible 
🙂
. We'll reach more people if we speak outside of LCW.
 
Talk soon!
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Wednesday, March 26, 2025 10:13 AM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>; Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Sales Reminders & Speaking Opportunities
 
 
Morning!
 
In addition to looking for speaking opportunities at Chicago SHRM & Hacking HR, et al, I also wanted to mention 
Transform
 - an HR Org. They have a Chicago chapter & I believe you might know someone who is part of that 
@Chuck Adams
 - 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/drjaisonwilliams/
.
 
Have either of you secured a speaking gig (even if an informal chat / interview) for April or May? 
 
You can also check local chambers of commerce - not just the Chicago one, but for ex, the German American Chamber in Chicago.
 
Also, don't forget to please log any calls, notes, and reminders in HubSpot. LMK if you need help with this. 
 
Thank you!
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Monday, March 10, 2025 9:54 AM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>; Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Fw: Speaking Opportunities
 
 
Good morning!
 
I will work to get an official doc together with all of this info (and will add more LinkedIn live-type shows), but in the meantime, I'm forwarding the below email with ideas for speaking. I know you have already started Alisa.
 
@Chuck
 - Maybe we have you slow down on the LCW webinars so you can focus on more of these? Would that enable you to do 1 a month you think? Or 1 every other month? LMK your capacity. I'd love to work out a calendar of sorts & have Kaitlyn put that together.
 
Thanks!
 
From:
 Nicole Barile <
n.barile@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, February 18, 2025 12:10 PM
To:
 Alisa Kolodizner <
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
>; Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Speaking Opportunities
 
 
Hi there,
 
I know we each have sales goals/KPIs & we are doing our best to reach those - making calls, responding to clients, tracking everything in HubSpot, etc. The LCW webinars, email campaigns, and our reach out efforts have increased traffic and interest in LCW - yay!
 
The areas I think we need to step up are 
speaking engagements & online presence.
 
I believe we agreed that 
Alisa
 would try to 
speak at 1 live event (virtual or in-person) once per month
. I know there is something upcoming.
 
I believe we agreed 
Chuck 
would try to do 
1 live event per quarter
,
 
in addition to
 the 1 or 2 LCW webinars
 he is leading 
each month
.
 
I would also kindly ask you both to 
post as much on LinkedIn
 as possible. I see you both do this. It would be great if you can increase that whenever possible.
 
To help in your search for where to speak, I've compiled the below orgs to help. 
 
As part of our
 sales strategy,
 we should be targeting 
legal
 orgs/associations (because they are always looking for DEI vendors & are often required to provide DEI services of some sort); 
HR 
orgs/associations (because as you know, we can find corporate DEI professionals here, and as DEI teams are disbanded, HR folks need to upskill), and 
Training & Development
 orgs/associations (similar to HR).
 
Here are suggested orgs to reach out to & approach for speaking gigs:
 
LEGAL
 
https://www.lcld.com/event/diversity-professionals-virtual-meeting-february-2025/
https://www.nalp.org/index.cfm
https://alfdp.com/
 
HR / L&D
https://hackinghrlab.io/events/people-culture-strategy-summit/
https://www.chicagoshrm.org/
 
https://atdchi.org/
 
I've attached a list of conferences
, but for most, we have missed the deadline for speaking. 
Of course there are many more opportunities out there. Please research on your own.
We hope to hire an admin shortly who can help us with these conference efforts - apply on our behalf to speak/present, find opportunities, etc.
 
Helpful tips:
Attached is a suggestion of what you can use to pitch to orgs to talk about - of course you can choose whatever you like
Post 3 times on LinkedIn about the event you will be speaking at
"Come see me speak at...."

"Thank you to X for having me..." (tag as above)
Use hashtags such as #DEI, #InclusionMatters, #BelongingAtWork #HR #HRLeadership #LearningAndDvelopment #TalentDevelopment
 
Happy to talk about this on our next call.
LMK if you have any questions.
 
Thanks!

Ratio specializes in helping companies close more deals, discount less, and get cash quicker by implementing our ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ program for your customers.

subject: Workplace Newsletter: 2025 Events, Spring Holidays & New Members
body:
Tanenbaum Workplace Newsletter | Spring 2025
 
Welcome to our Newest Members!
 
Tanenbaum would like to welcome its newest Members 
ASML, Corning Incorporated, and Michelin 
at the Associate Level.
They join a growing community of organizations committed to advancing religious diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
 
Tanenbaum at BYU Faith & Belief Case Competition
 
Last month, we attended BYU’s 3rd Annual MBA Case Competition on Faith and Belief at Work. Together with over 15 companies and students from MBA programs nationally and abroad, we encouraged solutions to address the business case for accommodating faith and belief at work.
The case for this year’s competition, which focused on the importance and value of interfaith ERGs, allowed students to think creatively and provide business considerations around the importance of valuing faith-based communities in the workplace.
Through these efforts in the competition, and included amongst the persuasive arguments by the students, we resoundingly agreed that inclusion for people of all faiths and none at work remains paramount.  
 
Stay Tuned for the 2025 Religious Diversity Leadership Summit
 
Our Workplace team is looking forward to convening members and partners at our upcoming 
2025
 
Religious Diversity Leadership Summit 
with this year’s theme, 
Building Community, Taking Action
.
We are excited to continue the legacy of our Summit in engaging the ways religion shows up as part of our workplace, workforce, and marketplaces. Look out for a save-the-date in the coming weeks.
Our Summit and Symposium offer invaluable opportunities for companies to take a proactive role in shaping the future of belonging and inclusion at work. Demonstrate your leadership in this space and consider supporting our annual events!
If you’re interested in sponsoring our Summit and Symposium, please email Lydia Baek at 
lbaek@tanenbaum.org
 or 
select some time here
 to meet with Workplace and the Development teams.
 
Plan for Upcoming Holidays 
 
 
Spring is a time of celebration and commemoration for many faith traditions.
Eid al-Fitr, the last day of the Muslim holy month of 
Ramadan
, is expected to take place on March 30th. April 13th is the start of the Theravada New Year, followed by the Sikh festival 
Vaisakhi
 on April 14th.
Passover
 
will begin at sundown on April 12th and end after nightfall on April 20th. This year, Western Christian Holy Week and Eastern Orthodox Christian Holy Week will coincide, with both 
Easter
 and Pascha falling on April 20th. 
The end of April brings the Festival of Ridvan. Bahai’is may suspend work on April 20th, April 28th, May 1st. May 12th is 
Vesak Day
, also known as Buddha Day, a celebration of the birth, enlightenment, and death of Siddhartha Gautama, the man who became the Buddha.
This season offers multiple opportunities to ensure that employees feel supported and respected in the workplace. We encourage everyone to consider the various accommodation needs that may arise and consult our 
Eight Steps to the Accommodation Mindset Fact Sheet
 as a meaningful starting point. 
We also offer a variety of 
workplace trainings
 to help create an environment where everyone feels respected and valued year-round.
 
Book a Workplace Training!
 
Creating inclusive workplaces for people of all faiths and none yields rich benefits in employee engagement and satisfaction.
Our trainings promote an awareness of how religious beliefs and practices impact behaviors in the workplace. This increased sensitivity helps dispel biases to enhance respectful collaborations across the workforce. 
Representative training options include:
Navigating Religious Diversity in the Workplace
 – an introduction to the topic of religious diversity in the workplace that addresses the business case for faith-based inclusion efforts.
Religious Diversity in the Workplace: Leveraging Cross-Cultural Allyship
 – highlights the intersectional nature of religion and belief and its utility in creating inclusive and respectful workplaces for employees of all identities.
Contact 
membership@tanenbaum.org
 to book a training now!
 
Spotlight: Competencies for Respectful Communication
 
One of our most frequently recommended resources, Tanenbaum’s 
Competencies for Respectful Communication
 outlines basic practices to help navigate difficult conversations at work.
One of these competencies is 
the Platinum Rule
. Many are familiar with the Golden Rule: to treat others the way you want to be treated. At Tanenbaum, we espouse the Platinum Rule: treat others the way 
they
 want to be treated. Respect looks different across religious traditions and cultures, and the only way to know what respect looks like to another person is to ask. 
Approaching these conversations with genuine curiosity and willingness to learn can help foster a respectful working environment.
 
 
Join Our April Film Screening!
Join us virtually or in-person for an upcoming free screening of 
American Sikh
 and 
Colonel Kalsi: Beyond the Call
 on April 15th, 6-8:30PM ET at the American Arbitration Association on 150 East 42nd Street. 
We'll be joined by American Sikh creator Vishavjit Singh and Kamal S. Kalsi for a panel discussion exploring how ethical representation of religion in the media can build empathy across communities. 
RSVP here
!
 
At this crucial time, you can actively fight religious hatred by supporting Tanenbaum.
Our real-world solutions make peace possible in the U.S. and globally.
